Company: The Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation
Parent Company: Freddie Mac (Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation)
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Company: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (Freddie Mac)
Parent Company: Freddie Mac (Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation)
Description: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (Freddie Mac) agreed to pay $50 million to settle allegations of securities fraud in connection with improper earnings management beginning as early as 1998 and lasting into 2002.

Parent Company: Freddie Mac (Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation)
Description: The New York Attorney General announced an agreement with Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac requiring them to only buy loans from banks that meet new standards designed to ensure independent and reliable appraisals. Each also agreed to contribute $12 million toward the cost of operating a new organization promoting those standards.

Parent Company: Freddie Mac (Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation)
